pr_title: Build tree to get all leaf nodes to abort process

timeline.bodyText:
For me an you leaf is an understandable word but not for the rest of the team.
Maybe renaming it to child processes or subProcessLeafs would be better.
timeline.author: enchobelezirev

timeline.bodyText:
This is a lot complexity: O(n^2).
Could we revert the things like this:

Find the execution which is related to the processInstanceId
Find each executions which have parentId = processInstaceId || superExecutionId = processInstanceId
Do 1 and 2, recursively for each execution foud in the step 2
Would this work?
This way we would lower the complexity to O(nlogn)
timeline.author: enchobelezirev

replies.bodyText:
About the complexity I do agree.
However, I am not sure if it worths to have recursion here in order to optimize a little bit when the code will not look nicer.
replies.author: boyan-velinov

timeline.bodyText:
What if there is a bug in the code? We would stay in the loop forever.
Maybe giving it some time would be enough in order the executions to finish. For instance, 10 mins MAX or more?
timeline.author: enchobelezirev

timeline.message:
Build tree to get all leaf nodes to abort process

When process is aborted, AbortProcessAction should wait
until all running subprocess have deadletter jobs.
So far AbortProcessAction do not wait and delete the process
hierarchy which lead to deadlock in DB.

Jira: LMCROSSITXSADEPLOY-1761
